articles.title: Chinese Vice-President Hopes for More Brisk Exchange between Chinese, Korean Youths
articles.content:
Chinese Vice-President Hopes for More Brisk Exchange between Chinese, Korean Youths

					Beijing, November 17 (KCNA Correspondent) -- I hope that exchange and visits would become more brisk between youths of China and the DPRK, said Vice-President of China Xi Jinping.
					
					Xi, member of the Standing Committee of the Political Bureau of the C.C., the Communist Party of China, Thursday met and had a talk with the visiting Korean youth friendly delegation led by Ri Yong Chol, first secretary of the C.C., the Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League, at the Great Hall of the People in Beijing.
					
					The Sino-DPRK friendship has steadily developed in depth over the past 60 odd years, Xi said, adding:
					
					The bilateral relations of friendship have made fresh progress under the deep care of the top leaders of the two countries.
					
					It is of importance in the development of the China-DPRK friendly and cooperative relations to strengthen exchange and cooperation between youth organizations of the two countries.
					
					Exchange and visits between the youths of the two countries are a work of strategic significance to lay a solid foundation for developing the bilateral friendship through generations under the complicated international situation in the new century.

articles.title: Congratulation to Liberian President
articles.content:
Congratulation to Liberian President

					Pyongyang, November 19 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Friday sent a congratulatory message to Ellen Johnson Sirleaf upon his reelection as president of Liberia.
					
					Kim in the message expressed belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would further develop and wished the president success in his responsible work for the country's stability and socio-economic development.

articles.title: Idea of Self-Reliance Accords with Specific Conditions of African Countries: Namibian PM
articles.content:
Idea of Self-Reliance Accords with Specific Conditions of African Countries: Namibian PM

					Pyongyang, November 19 (KCNA) -- The idea of self-reliance accords with the specific conditions of not only Namibia but all other African countries.
					
					Namibian Prime Minister Nahas Angula said this when DPRK Ambassador Jo Yong Man paid a courtesy call on him on Nov. 9.
					
					The Juche idea founded by President Kim Il Sung, the idea of self-reliance on building economy suited to the interests of one's own people by relying on one's own efforts is giving great strength and courage to the Namibian people, he noted.
